medium: Sprinkled gold on black lacquer with mother-of-pearl inlay
title: Box with Chrysanthemum Designs
text: This small box is decorated with a delicate design of blossoming chrysanthemums, emblematic of autumn. The artist's sparing use of iridescent mother-of-pearl is typical of lacquers produced during the 16th century in Japan. While the original use of this box is not known, such boxes were typically used to store cosmetics or incense.
description: Square Lacquer box (for storing incense?), 1550, chrysanthemum design on exterior with butterfly design on interior of lid; black lacquer, maki-e and mother-of-pearl shell inlay, and metal. Brocaded blue storage bag in A13.7 MS.
creditline: Gift of Funds of the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation
